trans-unit.source: Decision Forest Regression
trans-unit.target: Decision Forest Regression

trans-unit.source: Creates a regression model using the decision forest algorithm
trans-unit.target: Creates a regression model using the decision forest algorithm

trans-unit.source: Category: <legacyLink xlink:href="97F9510F-60BA-4D78-8A33-3078A6C7F260" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Machine Learning / Initialize Model / Regression</legacyLink>
trans-unit.target: Category: <legacyLink xlink:href="97F9510F-60BA-4D78-8A33-3078A6C7F260" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Machine Learning / Initialize Model / Regression</legacyLink>

trans-unit.source: Module Overview
trans-unit.target: Module Overview

trans-unit.source: You can use the <ui>Decision Forest Regression</ui> module to create a regression model using an ensemble of decision trees.
trans-unit.target: You can use the <ui>Decision Forest Regression</ui> module to create a regression model using an ensemble of decision trees.

trans-unit.source: After you have configured the model, you must train the model using a tagged dataset and the <link xlink:href="5cc7053e-aa30-450d-96c0-dae4be720977" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Train Model</link> module.
trans-unit.target: After you have configured the model, you must train the model using a tagged dataset and the <link xlink:href="5cc7053e-aa30-450d-96c0-dae4be720977" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Train Model</link> module.

trans-unit.source: The trained model can then be used to make predictions.
trans-unit.target: The trained model can then be used to make predictions.

trans-unit.source: Alternatively, the untrained model can be passed to <link xlink:href="75fb875d-6b86-4d46-8bcc-74261ade5826" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Cross Validate Model</link> for cross-validation against a labeled data set.
trans-unit.target: Alternatively, the untrained model can be passed to <link xlink:href="75fb875d-6b86-4d46-8bcc-74261ade5826" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Cross Validate Model</link> for cross-validation against a labeled data set.

trans-unit.source: Understanding Decision Forests for Regression
trans-unit.target: Understanding Decision Forests for Regression

trans-unit.source: Decision trees are non-parametric models that perform a sequence of simple tests for each instance, traversing a binary tree data structure until a leaf node (decision) is reached.
trans-unit.target: Decision trees are non-parametric models that perform a sequence of simple tests for each instance, traversing a binary tree data structure until a leaf node (decision) is reached.

trans-unit.source: Decision trees have these advantages:
trans-unit.target: Decision trees have these advantages:

trans-unit.source: They are efficient in both computation and memory usage during training and prediction.
trans-unit.target: They are efficient in both computation and memory usage during training and prediction.

trans-unit.source: They can represent non-linear decision boundaries.
trans-unit.target: They can represent non-linear decision boundaries.

trans-unit.source: They perform integrated feature selection and classification and are resilient in the presence of noisy features.
trans-unit.target: They perform integrated feature selection and classification and are resilient in the presence of noisy features.

trans-unit.source: This regression model consists of an ensemble of decision trees.
trans-unit.target: This regression model consists of an ensemble of decision trees.

trans-unit.source: Each tree in a regression decision forest outputs a Gaussian distribution by way of prediction.
trans-unit.target: Each tree in a regression decision forest outputs a Gaussian distribution by way of prediction.

trans-unit.source: An aggregation is performed over the ensemble of trees to find a Gaussian distribution closest to the combined distribution for all trees in the model.
trans-unit.target: An aggregation is performed over the ensemble of trees to find a Gaussian distribution closest to the combined distribution for all trees in the model.

trans-unit.source: How to Configure a Decision Forest Regression Model
trans-unit.target: How to Configure a Decision Forest Regression Model

trans-unit.source: Drag the <ui>Decision Forest Regression</ui> module into your experiment.
trans-unit.target: Drag the <ui>Decision Forest Regression</ui> module into your experiment.

trans-unit.source: Set model <legacyLink xlink:href="#bkmk_Options" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">options</legacyLink>.
trans-unit.target: Set model <legacyLink xlink:href="#bkmk_Options" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">options</legacyLink>.

trans-unit.source: Connect an instance of <link xlink:href="5cc7053e-aa30-450d-96c0-dae4be720977" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Train Model</link> or <link xlink:href="038d91b6-c2f2-42a1-9215-1f2c20ed1b40" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Sweep Parameters</link> to train the model using a tagged dataset.
trans-unit.target: Connect an instance of <link xlink:href="5cc7053e-aa30-450d-96c0-dae4be720977" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Train Model</link> or <link xlink:href="038d91b6-c2f2-42a1-9215-1f2c20ed1b40" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Sweep Parameters</link> to train the model using a tagged dataset.

trans-unit.source: <newTerm>Tagged</newTerm> means that the dataset contains a label column that contains the regression model’s expected output variable.
trans-unit.target: <newTerm>Tagged</newTerm> means that the dataset contains a label column that contains the regression model’s expected output variable.

trans-unit.source: The trained model can then be used to make predictions.
trans-unit.target: The trained model can then be used to make predictions.

trans-unit.source: Alternatively, the untrained model can be passed to <link xlink:href="75fb875d-6b86-4d46-8bcc-74261ade5826" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Cross Validate Model</link> for cross-validation against a labeled data set.
trans-unit.target: Alternatively, the untrained model can be passed to <link xlink:href="75fb875d-6b86-4d46-8bcc-74261ade5826" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Cross Validate Model</link> for cross-validation against a labeled data set.

trans-unit.source: Options
trans-unit.target: Options

trans-unit.source: You can configure a regression model using the same parameters that apply to other decision forest models:
trans-unit.target: You can configure a regression model using the same parameters that apply to other decision forest models:

trans-unit.source: Resampling method
trans-unit.target: Resampling method

trans-unit.source: You can specify which method should be used to combine the results of individual trees.
trans-unit.target: You can specify which method should be used to combine the results of individual trees.

trans-unit.source: You can choose from <newTerm>bagging</newTerm> or <newTerm>replication</newTerm>.
trans-unit.target: You can choose from <newTerm>bagging</newTerm> or <newTerm>replication</newTerm>.

trans-unit.source: <legacyItalic><ui>Bagging</ui></legacyItalic>.
trans-unit.target: <legacyItalic><ui>Bagging</ui></legacyItalic>.

trans-unit.source: Select this option to use bagging, also called <newTerm>bootstrap aggregating</newTerm>.
trans-unit.target: Select this option to use bagging, also called <newTerm>bootstrap aggregating</newTerm>.

trans-unit.source: Each tree in a regression decision forest outputs a Gaussian distribution by way of prediction.
trans-unit.target: Each tree in a regression decision forest outputs a Gaussian distribution by way of prediction.

trans-unit.source: The aggregation is to find a Gaussian whose first two moments match the moments of the mixture of Gaussians given by combining all Gaussians returned by individual trees.
trans-unit.target: The aggregation is to find a Gaussian whose first two moments match the moments of the mixture of Gaussians given by combining all Gaussians returned by individual trees.

trans-unit.source: <legacyItalic><ui>Replicate</ui></legacyItalic>.
trans-unit.target: <legacyItalic><ui>Replicate</ui></legacyItalic>.

trans-unit.source: In replication, each tree is trained on exactly the same input data.
trans-unit.target: In replication, each tree is trained on exactly the same input data.

trans-unit.source: Number of decision trees
trans-unit.target: Number of decision trees

trans-unit.source: Specify the total number of decision trees that are created in the ensemble.
trans-unit.target: Specify the total number of decision trees that are created in the ensemble.

trans-unit.source: By creating more decision trees, you can potentially get better coverage, but training time will increase.
trans-unit.target: By creating more decision trees, you can potentially get better coverage, but training time will increase.

trans-unit.source: Maximum depth of the decision trees
trans-unit.target: Maximum depth of the decision trees

trans-unit.source: Specify the maximum depth of each tree in the ensemble.
trans-unit.target: Specify the maximum depth of each tree in the ensemble.

trans-unit.source: Increasing the depth of a tree has the effect of increasing precision at the risk of some overfitting and increased training time.
trans-unit.target: Increasing the depth of a tree has the effect of increasing precision at the risk of some overfitting and increased training time.

trans-unit.source: Number of random splits per node
trans-unit.target: Number of random splits per node

trans-unit.source: Specify the number of splits to use when building each node of the tree.
trans-unit.target: Specify the number of splits to use when building each node of the tree.

trans-unit.source: At each split, features in each level of the tree (node) are randomly divided.
trans-unit.target: At each split, features in each level of the tree (node) are randomly divided.

trans-unit.source: Minimum number of samples per leaf node
trans-unit.target: Minimum number of samples per leaf node

trans-unit.source: Type a value that defines the number of samples or case required to create a decision tree leaf node.
trans-unit.target: Type a value that defines the number of samples or case required to create a decision tree leaf node.

trans-unit.source: By increasing this value, you increase the threshold for creating new rules.
trans-unit.target: By increasing this value, you increase the threshold for creating new rules.

trans-unit.source: For example, with the default value of 1, even a single case can cause a new rule to be created.
trans-unit.target: For example, with the default value of 1, even a single case can cause a new rule to be created.

trans-unit.source: If you increase the value to 5, the training data would have to contain at least 5 cases that meet the same conditions.
trans-unit.target: If you increase the value to 5, the training data would have to contain at least 5 cases that meet the same conditions.

trans-unit.source: Allow unknown values for categorical features
trans-unit.target: Allow unknown values for categorical features

trans-unit.source: When this option is selected, the model will create a grouping for Unknown values.
trans-unit.target: When this option is selected, the model will create a grouping for Unknown values.

trans-unit.source: If you deselect this option, the model can accept only the values contained in the training data.
trans-unit.target: If you deselect this option, the model can accept only the values contained in the training data.

trans-unit.source: In the former case, the model might be less precise on known values but provide better predictions for new (unknown) values.
trans-unit.target: In the former case, the model might be less precise on known values but provide better predictions for new (unknown) values.

trans-unit.source: Recommendations
trans-unit.target: Recommendations

trans-unit.source: If you have limited data or want to minimize the time spent training the model, try these settings:
trans-unit.target: If you have limited data or want to minimize the time spent training the model, try these settings:

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Limited training set. </legacyBold>If the training set contains a limited number of instances:
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Limited training set. </legacyBold>If the training set contains a limited number of instances:

trans-unit.source: Create the decision forest using a large number of decision trees (for example, more than 20)
trans-unit.target: Create the decision forest using a large number of decision trees (for example, more than 20)

trans-unit.source: Use the <ui>Bagging</ui> option for resampling
trans-unit.target: Use the <ui>Bagging</ui> option for resampling

trans-unit.source: Specify a large number of random splits per node (for example, more than 1000)
trans-unit.target: Specify a large number of random splits per node (for example, more than 1000)

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Limited training time. </legacyBold>If the training set contains a large number of instances and training time is limited:
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Limited training time. </legacyBold>If the training set contains a large number of instances and training time is limited:

trans-unit.source: Create the decision forest using fewer decision trees (for example, 5-10)
trans-unit.target: Create the decision forest using fewer decision trees (for example, 5-10)

trans-unit.source: Use the <ui>Replicate</ui> option for resampling
trans-unit.target: Use the <ui>Replicate</ui> option for resampling

trans-unit.source: Specify a small number of random splits per node (for example, less than 100)
trans-unit.target: Specify a small number of random splits per node (for example, less than 100)

trans-unit.source: Examples
trans-unit.target: Examples

trans-unit.source: For examples of regression models, see these sample experiments in the <externalLink><linkText>Model Gallery</linkText><linkUri>http://gallery.azureml.net/</linkUri></externalLink>:
trans-unit.target: For examples of regression models, see these sample experiments in the <externalLink><linkText>Model Gallery</linkText><linkUri>http://gallery.azureml.net/</linkUri></externalLink>:

trans-unit.source: The <externalLink><linkText>Compare Regression Models sample</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525731</linkUri></externalLink> contrasts several different kinds of regression models.
trans-unit.target: The <externalLink><linkText>Compare Regression Models sample</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525731</linkUri></externalLink> contrasts several different kinds of regression models.

trans-unit.source: The <externalLink><linkText>sentiment analysis sample</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525274</linkUri></externalLink> uses several different regression models to generate predicted ratings.
trans-unit.target: The <externalLink><linkText>sentiment analysis sample</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525274</linkUri></externalLink> uses several different regression models to generate predicted ratings.
